page.title: 04CONSERVATION IN STOKE DOYLE
page.content: Mr.Knight, one of the farmers in Stoke Doyle, runs a 1,000 acre farm. Like many famers he gets blamed for destroying a lot of vegetation like hedgerows. So to put a stop to that he plants things that have nothing to do with his main crops. In the corner of one field he has planted some conifers and in a rather wet area nearby another local farmer has planted several different types of wild grass - over 60 types altogether. These farmers don't get any money for doing this. They do it of their own free will and to make the landscape much nicer. Also we saw the farmer's dog catch a rabbit in one of the new pieces of woodland, so he likes it too!
